meanings.definition: A long, segmented arthropod with many legs, each body segment typically having two pairs of legs.
meanings.sent1: Millipedes crawl slowly on the ground, each segment with two pairs of legs.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of millipedes moving across the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The millipedes had a race, but they all moved at a snail's pace!
meanings.sent4: The line of millipedes resembled a moving train of legs.
meanings.sent5: The millipedes' multitude of legs made them look like tiny centipedes in a row.

meanings.definition: A small, wormlike animal with a hard exoskeleton and many legs.
meanings.sent1: The millipedes burrowed into the soil to hide from predators.
meanings.sent2: My sister found a millipede in the garden and gently picked it up.
meanings.sent3: The millipedes had a party underground, celebrating their many legs!
meanings.sent4: The millipedes' exoskeletons were as tough as armor.
meanings.sent5: The tiny millipedes scurried across the path, their legs moving rapidly.
